articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Flight Training of KPA Unit 1017
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Flight Training of KPA Unit 1017
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, guided flight training at Unit 1017 of the Air and Anti-Air Forces of the KPA honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led Seventh Regiment. 
					 He was greeted on the spot by KPA Air Force General Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the air and anti-air forces of the KPA, and other commanding officers of the unit. 
					
					 He received a salute before mounting the commanding post.
					
					 After receiving the report about the training program, he guided the flight training there. 
					
					 At the balcony of the commanding post, he watched for a long time the training of pilots. 
					
					 He praised the pilots for doing the training well, saying that the sky over the country will always be blue and safe thanks to the reliable pilots firmly defending the inviolable territorial air of the socialist country as an impregnable fortress.
					
					 He stressed the need to train them as death-defying corps in sky and able combat pilots capable of skillfully coping with modern warfare. 
					
					 He met with the pilots who took part in the training and encouraged them. 
					
					 He went to the runway and looked around planes. 
					
					 The pilots and maintenance personnel should take good care of the planes, precious hardware in defending the socialist country, and ensure flight at a moment's notice, he said. 
					
					 He expressed great expectation and belief that the servicepersons of the unit will put spurs to rounding off the combat preparedness to firmly safeguard the sky over the country. 
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, director of the KPA General Political Bureau, KPA Vice Marshal Hyon Chol Hae, first vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and Hwang Pyong So and Kim Pyong Ho, vice department directors of the Central Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Party Leader
 Hanoi, August 7 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday paid a courtesy call on Nguyen Phu Trong, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam.
					 Kim conveyed greetings of the dear respected Kim Jong Un to Nguyen Phu Trong.
					
					 Nguyen Phu Trong expressed deep thanks for this and asked Kim to convey his heartfelt greetings to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He said he was pleased with the successful celebrations of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, the Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Fifth Session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly.
					
					 The Korean people are registering big achievements in building a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, he noted.
					
					 He expressed deep thanks to the DPRK government and people for positively supporting the Vietnamese people in their struggle for national liberation and the reunification of the country. He expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung would continue to boost.
					
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kang Min Chol, minister of Mining Industry, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Chang Il, DPRK ambassador to Vietnam, and from the Vietnamese side were the director of the General Office of the Presidency, Vu Dung, assistant to the general secretary of the Communist Party of Vietnam, Hoang Binh Quan, chairman of the Commission for External Relations of the C.C., the Communist Party of Vietnam, Ho Xuan Son, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Le Quang Ba Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 The conversation took place in an amicable atmosphere.

articles.title: Talks between Kim Yong Nam and Vietnamese President
articles.content:
Talks between Kim Yong Nam and Vietnamese President
 Hanoi, August 7 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Talks were held between Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Vietnamese President Truong Tan Sang at the Presidency on Monday.
					 The two sides exchanged views on the issues of consolidating and developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and matters of mutual concerns.
					
					 The DPRK side referred to the unique leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who has wisely led the party, the army and the people of the DPRK to construction of a thriving socialist country.
					
					 It also underlined the need to further develop the bilateral relations and steadily boost cooperation in regional and international arenas including the Non-Aligned Movement.
					
					 The Vietnamese side sincerely congratulated Kim Jong Un on holding the top posts of the party and the state, wishing the Korean people greater success in building a thriving socialist country under the leadership of the WPK.
					
					 The party, the government and the people of Vietnam will make efforts to develop the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.
					
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kang Min Chol, minister of Mining Industry, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Chang Il, DPRK ambassador to Vietnam.
					
					 Present there from the Vietnamese side were the director of the General Office of the Presidency, Vu Huy Hoang, minister of Industry and Commerce, Ho Xuan Son, deputy minister of Foreign Affairs, Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, Nguyen Duc Di, assistant to the president, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Vietnamese President Hosts Banquet for Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Vietnamese President Hosts Banquet for Kim Yong Nam
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese President Truong Tan Sang hosted a banquet on Monday in honor of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on an official goodwill visit to Vietnam.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Nam, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kang Min Chol, minister of Mining Industry, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other suite members, Kim Chang Il, DPRK ambassador to Vietnam, and staff members of his embassy in Hanoi. 
					
					 Present there were the director of the General Office of the Presidency, Minister of Industry and Commerce Vu Huy Hoang, Vice-minister of Foreign Affairs Ho Xuan Son, Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, and officials concerned. 
					
					 Truong Tan Sang made a speech at the banquet. 
					
					 He said that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung are developing on good terms.
					
					  The Vietnam-DPRK relations of friendship will grow stronger in mutual interests amidst the deep concern of the top leaders of the two countries, he said.
					
					  He reiterated warm felicitations to the grand political events of the Korean people this year.
					
					   He heartily wished the fraternal Korean people greater success under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam spoke next. 
					
					 He said that he could witness the successes gained by the Vietnamese people under the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam during his visit.
					
					  It is the fixed stand of the DPRK government to value and steadily boost the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries, he said. 
					
					 He expressed the conviction that the current visit would be an occasion in boosting the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation which has a long history, excellent tradition and great potentials.
					
					 There was a performance given by artistes.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese PM
 Hanoi, August 7 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday had a friendly conversation with Nguyen Tan Dung, prime minister of the Vietnamese government. 
					 The Vietnamese prime minister said that the party, state and people of Vietnam are grateful to the party, state and people of the DPRK for positive support for Vietnamese struggle against the U.S. and for national salvation and always remember it.
					
					 Vietnam attaches great importance to the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, he said.
					
					 He expressed conviction that the Korean people under the guidance of the dear respected Kim Jong Un will surely build a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Welcomed in Vietnam
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Welcomed in Vietnam
 Hanoi, August 7 (KCNA Correspondent) -- A function took place at the Vietnamese Presidential Office on Monday to welcome Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to Vietnam.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kang Min Chol, minister of Mining Industry, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Chang Il, DPRK ambassador to Vietnam, and other suite members.
					
					 Vietnamese President Truong Tan Sang, the director of the General Office of the Presidency, Minister of Industry and Commerce Vu Huy Hoang, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Ho Xuan Son, Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Le Quang Ba and Assistant to the President Nguyen Duc Di and officials concerned were on hand.
					
					 The national anthems of the DPRK and Vietnam were played.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam together with the Vietnamese president reviewed a guard of honor of the Vietnamese People's Army.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Lays Wreath before Grave of Ho Chi Minh
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Lays Wreath before Grave of Ho Chi Minh
 Hanoi, August 7 (KCNA correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on an official goodwill visit to the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, laid a wreath before the grave of Ho Chi Minh on Tuesday.
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kang Min Chol, minister of Mining Industry, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Chang Il, DPRK ambassador to Vietnam, and other suite members, the director of the General Office of the Presidency of Vietnam, Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, and other officials concerned.
					
					 After laying the wreath before the grave, Kim and his party observed a moment's silence in memory of Ho.
					
					 Prior to this, they laid a wreath before the monument to the fallen heroic martyrs.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Vientiane
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Vientiane
 Vientiane, August 7 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Tuesday arrived in Vientiane to pay an official goodwill visit to the Lao People's Democratic Republic at the invitation of Laotian President Choummaly Sayasone.
					 Accompanying him were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kang Min Chol, minister of Mining Industry, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other suite members.
					
					 Kim and his party left Vietnam that day.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Finnish Ambassador
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Finnish Ambassador
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Finnish Ambassador to the DPRK Pekka Wuoristo who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Finnish Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Finnish Ambassador
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Pekka Wuoristo, outgoing Finnish ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a visit to him on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Members of German Bundestag
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Member of German Bundestag
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Tuesday met and had a talk with Michael Luther, member of Bundestag from the Christian Democratic Union of Germany, and his companion who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Commander of KPA Air and Anti-Air Forces Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Commander of KPA Air and Anti-Air Forces Leaves for Russia
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the air and anti-air forces of the Korean People's Army, and his party left here on Tuesday to visit Russia.

articles.title: DPRK, Japanese Red Cross Bodies to Have Talks
articles.content:
DPRK, Japanese Red Cross Bodies to Have Talks
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Talks between the DPRK Red Cross Society and Japan Red Cross Society will be held in Beijing, China on August 9 and 10.

articles.title: DPRK-Russia Joint Friendship Meeting Held
articles.content:
DPRK-Russia Joint Friendship Meeting Held
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A DPRK-Russia joint friendship meeting was held at DPRK-Russia friendship Moranbong Secondary School No. 1 Tuesday to mark the 10th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to Far East region of the Russian Federation and the first anniversary of his visit to Siberia and Far East region.
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Alexandr Timonin and staff members of the Russian embassy and Russian students studying here.
					
					 So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned, teaching staff and students of the secondary school attended.
					
					 The participants looked round various educational facilities of the school and enjoyed an art performance given by students. They deepened friendly feelings, playing sports and amusement games and conversing with each other.

articles.title: Participants in Pyongyang Machine Exhibition Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants in Pyongyang Machine Exhibition Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 2012 Pyongyang Machine Equipment Exhibition visited Mangyongdae on August 7.
					 They visited the old home of President Kim Il Sung and looked round the historic relics there, being briefed on his revolutionary history and family members.
					
					 Zhu Zhongxing, vice-director of the bureau of foreign trade and development of the Chinese Ministry of Commerce, said he deemed it honor to visit the old home at Mangyongdae, birthplace of the President.
					
					 He added:
					
					 The President's family is a patriotic and revolutionary family.
					
					 All the members of his family were ardent patriots.
					
					 He started revolutionary activities when he was young and devoted his whole life to the liberation and prosperity of the country and the people's happiness. 
					
					 He was the great leader of the Korean people and a close friend of the Chinese people.

articles.title: New Wind Power Generator, Solar Lamp Invented in DPRK
articles.content:
New Wind Power Generator, Solar Lamp Invented in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Scientists and technicians in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have invented new kinds of one kilowatt-capacity wind power generator and solar garden lamp.
					 The household generator is 15 percent higher in efficiency than the previous ones.
					
					 It can generate electricity at wind speed 2.5-13 meters per second, with no mechanical problem at a higher wind speed.
					
					 With three wings, it can ensure 24 voltages of electricity in direct current and can run for 10 years.
					
					 The solar garden lamp is made with locally available raw materials.
					
					 It works 8 hours a day on the average and can operate in five consecutive rainy or cloudy days.
					
					 Those inventions have already been introduced to Kim Chaek University of Technology and some dwelling houses and industrial establishments in North Phyongan Province and other areas.

articles.title: KCNA Lauds Kim Jong Il's Journey of Patriotic Devotion
articles.content:
KCNA Lauds Kim Jong Il's Journey of Patriotic Devotion
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency made public a report on leader Kim Jong Il's great whole life of patriotic devotion on August 6.
					 The report said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il's life was characterized by the boundless loyalty of the peerlessly great patriot who successfully defended the socialist homeland liberated by President Kim Il Sung and devoted his all to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people with the noblest outlook on the country, people and posterity.
					
					 He made the journey for the sake of the country and people to the last moments of his life.
					
					 He made over 669,844 km-long journey all his life, equivalent to traveling round the globe nearly 17 times.
					
					 His forced march was, indeed, an epic-like journey of a hero as he always shared his destiny with the servicepersons and people as a genuine patriot of the country.
					
					 Whenever he visited servicepersons and workers displaying the remarkable patriotic zeal, he highly appreciated the fighting spirit displayed by them in performing feats, and warmly encouraged them by reposing absolute trust in them and showing loving care.
					
					 The revolutionary soldier spirit and the Kanggye spirit were created amid warm affection between the leader and his soldiers, and all the service members and people turned out as one in hearty response to the leader's patriotic call.
					
					 The creation of the spirits led to the vigorous campaign for general offensive which was called the torch of Hamnam, in the wake of the creation of the Songgang, Ranam and Kangson torches that resulted in remarkably augmenting the ideological and moral might of the people of the DPRK.
					
					 During the arduous march, the revolutionary military songs resounded far and wide by the State Merited Chorus as a trumpet of the times, encouraging all the servicepersons and people to the advance.
					
					 In the period, art performances given by service members and families of service persons, concerts by Unhasu Orchestra, light comedy "An Echo among the Hills", drama "We Will Recollect Today", etc. instilled warm patriotism into the minds of all service members and people.
					
					 He defended the homeland, nation, socialism and world peace by enforcing his original Songun politics and converted the DPRK into the world military power which no formidable enemy dares provoke.
					
					 This was the greatest feats performed by Generalissimo Kim Jong Il out of patriotism.
					
					 On August 25, 1960, he provided field guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army.
					
					Since then he visited his beloved soldiers and prepared them to be the fighters of devotedly defending the leader and patriotic fighters who are ready to risk their lives to defend the country.
					
					 He visited at least 12,790 units while providing the Songun revolutionary leadership. The distance of field guidance provided by him totaled 629,992 km.
					
					 Under the loving care of the illustrious commander of Songun, the KPA became the elite revolutionary armed forces of Mt. Paektu capable of beating back any formidable enemy at a single strike.
					
					 The DPRK's defence industry developed into a cutting-edge industry capable of producing any military hardware with tremendous striking power at will.
					
					 He trained the service members to be the driving force not only for defending the country and building a thriving socialist nation but also for providing the happy life of the people.
					
					 He laid a firm foundation for building an economic power through his warm patriotic devotion.
					
					 This is another great feat to be recorded in the history of the country along with the era of Songun.
					
					 The arduous journey of more than 353,576 km made by the great patriot, the great man, specially went down in the history of the country as he continued the journey to the last moments of his life in the van of the arduous march, taking a short and uncomfortable nap and having a rice-ball.
					
					 His patriotic motto calling for living not merely for today but for tomorrow has been cherished in the hearts of all the people of the country, emboldening them to the struggle for providing the happiness for generations to come.
					
					 There sprang up the Huichon Power Station thanks to his great bold decision and under his energetic and devoted leadership.
					
					 This grand edifice of the Songun era is a noble patriotic legacy bequeathed down by the peerlessly great man for the country and the people.
					
					 The last three years of his life were years of a popular and heroic life of the peerlessly great patriot who worked day and night leading the advancing ranks amid the high-pitched drive with the firm will not to allow even a moment's stop in the forced march toward a final victory.
					
					 In those days, he energetically traveled from the east to the west and from the west to the north of the country as President            Kim Il Sung did in the anti-Japanese armed struggle period.
					
					 In those period, he provided field guidance to nearly 1,000 units.
					
					 The number of the units visited by him only for 100 days since early in January of 2009 reached four times that of the same period of the previous year.
					
					 He traveled almost tens of thousands of kilometers throughout the country.
					
					 He performed undying feats for the era, revolution, country and people with his outstanding ideologies and theories, rare leadership ability and steel-strong will by making painstaking efforts, and worked with ardent patriotism all his life.
					
					 He was on a train in his journey for the people even at the last moment of his life when his heart stopped beating.
					
					 His revolutionary career represents the holy history of the sun to be recorded for all ages along with the prosperity of Kim Il Sung's nation.
					
					 The history of the forced march made by him is associated with the boundless devotion to the country, the revolution and the people. It is, indeed, a legendary history of patriotism which could be made only by Kim Jong Il, the peerlessly great patriot and the father of the people.

articles.title: KCNA Report on Kim Jong Il's Journey of Patriotic Devotion(1)
articles.content:
KCNA Report on Kim Jong Il's Journey of Patriotic Devotion(1)
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency issued a report Monday on the immortal life of leader Kim Jong Il characterized by patriotic devotion. 
					 KCNA said in the report:
					
					 Kim Jong Il's was a career of boundless loyalty of a peerless patriot who reliably protected socialist Korea, liberated by President Kim Il Sung, and devoted everything to the country's prosperity and the people's happiness with the noblest outlook on the country, people and the future generations.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, who was born as the shining star on Mt. Paektu during the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea, cherished a patriotic will to build a country where the people's happiness would come true after he embarked on the road of revolution, taking as his lifetime task the cause of patriotism started in Mangyongdae and carried forward as the lifeline of revolution.
					
					 In the first spring after the country's liberation young Kim Jong Il mounted Moran Hill together with Kim Il Sung and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. At that time he made up his mind to green the whole country in the future.
					
					 During the Fatherland Liberation War he wrote and composed song "Embrace of Country", culmination of ardent patriotism, and planted two young pine-nut trees, foreseeing the victory in the war.
					
					 Kim Jong Il witnessed the heroic Korean people's determined struggle for postwar rehabilitation and construction and basic socialist construction under the leadership of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He realized an immutable truth that Korean prospering socialism is sure to win as long as there are the outstanding leader and the people rallied close around him.
					
					 On Sept. 1, 1960 Kim Jong Il entered Kim Il Sung University. That day he mounted Ryongnam Hill on the campus and made an oath to glorify Korea all over the world, upholding the cause of Kim Il Sung. It was a great patriotic declaration replete with his faith and will to build a paradise of Juche in his beloved country.
					
					 Since he started work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on June 19, 1964, he advanced more vigorously the cause of patriotism for the country's prosperity and the people's happiness.
					
					 He declared modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism as the WPK's top programme on Feb. 19, 1974 with his extraordinary ideological and theoretical wisdom. 
					
					 He had since made public lots of works that contained rich practical experience and ideological and theoretical contents to make all the Koreans burn their hearts with absolute loyalty to the leader and ardent love for the country.
					
					 Kim Jong Il made a long journey totaling more than 669,844km, equivalent to about 17 rounds of the globe, for his beloved country and people till the last moments of his great life.
					
					 It is an epic-like career of a genuine heroic patriot who always shared weal and woe and destiny with the service persons and people.

articles.title: US-S. Korea War Confab under Fire
articles.content:
US-S. Korea War Confab under Fire
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, the U.S. deputy secretary of Defense flew to south Korea to hold military confab with Kim Song Hwan, "minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade," and Kim Kwan Jin, "defense minister."
					 The senior U.S. and south Korean officials discussed the issue of "tightening alliance" under the new defense strategy, stressing the importance of "resetting the strategic equilibrium in the Asian region".
					
					 They also had confab on the issue of the DPRK's "movement" and the proposal of making cooperation in the "policy toward the north".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The recent military confab was a dangerous meeting between the American master and its servants to hatch a plot against the DPRK.
					
					 The meeting precisely aimed at another war against the DPRK as it is little different from firing a signal flare for the war.
					
					 What merits more serious attention is that the Lee Myung Bak regime is acting a shock brigade in carrying out the strategy.
					
					 It was clearly proved by remarks made by the regime that it was once again convinced of the significance of the "alliance".
					
					 All facts indicate that the U.S. policy for invasion of the DPRK remains unchanged and that the reckless action of the Lee regime to invade the north with the backing of its American master has reached the dangerous phase.
					
					 Their hysteria is little short of pouring oil to the fire.
					
					 The provocateurs will face only doom.

articles.title: US Hit for Attempting Preemptive Attack on DPRK
articles.content:
US Hit for Attempting Preemptive Attack on DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the U.S. opened to the public its deployment of Bunker-buster targeting the DPRK and Iran. It let the secretary of the Air Force make a spate of balderdash about the blowing power of the new bomb and the maximum distance which it can penetrate to destroy underground nuclear facilities. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 This is another grave military provocation against the DPRK and an undisguised declaration of confrontation with it.
					
					 The U.S. developed and deployed this bomb with an aim to carry out its scenario for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 It is seeking to mount a preemptive strike at major military objects of the DPRK which are of strategic significance and thus neutralize the DPRK's military muscle for self-defence and realize its strategy for stifling the DPRK by force of arms. This proves that the strategy for world hegemony by force of arms still remains a major mode of the U.S. for realizing its foreign policy and it is its persistent intention to apply this to the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Now that the dignity and security of the DPRK have been seriously threatened by the U.S. evermore intensified hostile policy toward it, there is no other choice but to bolster up its military muscle for self-defence.
					
					 The military and technological advantages are not a monopoly of the U.S. and will not work on the DPRK today.
					
					 The further the U.S. steps up pressure on the DPRK by force of arms, the further the DPRK will strengthen countermeasures.
					
					 The U.S. should stop at once the anachronistic military rackets, pondering over the consequences to be entailed by its moves for confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Carrying Forward June 15 Era of Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Carrying Forward June 15 Era of Reunification
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Giving continuity to the June 15 era for Korea's reunification by foiling confrontation moves of the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea will guarantee the independent reunification, peace and prosperity of Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article:
					
					 The inter-Korean relations would have made remarkable progress if the trend of implementing the June 15 joint declaration had continued based on the three principles of national reunification.
					
					 The prevailing situation, however, is deplorable. The achievements in the era of independent reunification are wantonly trampled on and the north-south confrontation has plunged the bilateral ties into an uncontrollable phase.
					
					 The danger of war is looming on this land due to the Lee group of traitors who dared hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and attempted to perpetrate hideous terrorism.
					
					 The Lee group denied and violated the north-south declarations the root of which is the three principles of national reunification, thus overturning the foundation of the north-south relations.
					
					 It would be impossible to expect the advance of the June 15 era of reunification and ensure the peace and reunification with the vicious group against national reunification left intact.
					
					 All the Koreans in and out are well aware through the checkered movement for the national reunification that a new era of reunification and prosperity of Korea can open only when the Korean nation shares the will and pools efforts on the principles of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					
					 The prevailing situation teaches the Koreans a serious lesson that the gains of the June 15 era should never be lost, and helps them harden their will and resolution to carry forward the cause of national reunification without fail.

articles.title: Korean People Will Never Pardon US Acts of Subversion: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Korean People Will Never Pardon US Acts of Subversion: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Korean people will never pardon the U.S. acts of subversion and sabotage aimed to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK which the Koreans consider dearer than their own lives, but destroy every move of hooligans. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article. It goes on:
					
					 The U.S.-led acts of subversion and sabotage against statues and grand monuments in the DPRK are a serious violation of international law and grave state-sponsored politically-motivated terrorism.
					
					 No country in the world tries as hard as the U.S., a country which adopted plot-breeding and terrorism as its policy and makes desperate efforts to attain its purpose of domination through it. The U.S. labeled those countries which stand in the way of realizing its purpose of domination as "dangerous forces" and "unstable factor".
					
					 The U.S. has overturned and destroyed governments which it considered as an obstacle in establishing the order of dominating the world and assassinated progressive politicians. It has made no scruple of committing open aggressive acts when it found it impossible to achieve the purpose through the said method.
					
					 The U.S. policy of unilateralism and hegemonism leads to the military aggression and state-sponsored terrorism against other countries, harassing peace, wrecking stability and plunging the world into confusion and instability.
					
					 The U.S. fosters terrorism in countries it set as targets and interferes in their internal affairs under the pretext of opposing terrorism.
					
					 The state-sponsored politically-motivated terrorism against the DPRK which the U.S. planned by instigating the south Korean puppet regime proved once again that it is the chieftain of terrorism and the world's worst terrorist sponsor.
					
					 It is a foolish daydream for the U.S. to try to get something through the method of anachronistic state-sponsored terrorism.

articles.title: Naughty Brisbane Metro Challenges Olympic Spirit: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Naughty Brisbane Metro Challenges Olympic Spirit: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Australian newspaper Brisbane Metro behaved so sordid as to describe the DPRK as "Naughty Korea" when carrying the news of London Olympics standings.
					 This is a bullying act little short of insulting the Olympic spirit of solidarity, friendship and progress and politicizing sports. 
					
					 Media are obliged to lead the public in today's highly-civilized world where mental and cultural level of mankind is being displayed at the highest level. Brisbane Metro deserves criticism for what it has done. 
					
					 The paper behaved so foolish as to use the London Olympics that has caught the world interest for degrading itself. 
					
					 The paper hardly known in the world must have thought of making its existence known to the world by joining other media in reporting the Olympic news. 
					
					 Then it should have presented its right appearance to the world. 
					
					 Editors of the paper were so incompetent as to tarnish the reputation of the paper by themselves by producing the article like that. 
					
					 There is a saying "A straw may show which way the wind blows". A single article may exhibit the level of the paper. 
					
					 Many people were unanimous in denouncing the small paper for defaming the mental and moral aspects of the players of the DPRK who earned recognition from several appreciative world famous media.
					
					 Even hostile forces toward the DPRK heaped praises on its players' successful performance at the London Olympics, saying that "Korea whirlwind" sweeps the world. 
					
					 The Australian paper cooked up the way of moneymaking, challenging the authority of the dignified sovereign state. The paper deserves a trifle sum of dirty money. 
					
					 As already known, it was reported that a lot of petty thieves sneaked into the London Olympics together with tourists. Players fight to the finish in the stadium, but those petty thieves demonstrate their "skills" outside the stadium. 
					
					 The paper Brisbane Metro is little different from those petty thieves. In a word, the paper discredited itself. How pitiful it is. 
					
					 The Brisbane Metro will remain as a symbol of rogue paper for its misdeed to be cursed long in Olympic history. The infamy is the self-product of the naughty paper Brisbane Metro which dared challenge the spirit of Olympic, common desire and unanimous will of mankind.

articles.title: KCNA Brands Japan as Corrupt Country
articles.content:
KCNA Brands Japan as Corrupt Country
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- An event took place at the U.S. Capitol on July 24 to commemorate the 5th anniversary of the resolution related to the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 Participants at the event expressed concern about the Japanese authorities turning their faces away from the resolution which called on Japan to make apology and reparation for reducing many Asian women including Korean women to sexual slaves for the Japanese army.
					
					 They stated that it is necessary to refer the issue of sexual slavery committed by the Japanese army to the UN and develop the resolution into an international treaty punishing those who sexually assaulted women in wartime period.
					
					 This indicates the daily growing resentment of the international community at Japan which has not admitted even the Japanese imperialists' sexual assaults against women during World War II.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists kidnapped or forcibly took away 200,000 women from Korea alone in the last century and reduced them to sexual slaves for aggressor forces. They did not hesitate to massacre those women in a bid to conceal their horrible crimes.
					
					 The sexual slavery committed by the Japanese imperialists was a hideous crime against humanity which can hardly be found in human history.
					
					 Nevertheless, the Japanese authorities still refuse to make honest apology and reparation for Japan's past barbarous crimes.
					
					 Japan's prime minister takes the lead in it. He has made unethical remarks, claiming that the expression of sexual slavery for the Japanese army was wrong. These thoughtless remarks made by the chief executive are enough to indicate the stand and attitude of Japanese politicians to the issue of post-war handling of Japan.
					
					 Openly heard from the Japanese reactionaries are such reckless remarks as branding the sexual slavery committed by the Japanese army as "deeds of individual procurers for prostitution" and "victims' voluntary acts for earning money". All these are attributable to such stand of officials concerned in Japan.
					
					 Japan is, indeed, a corrupt country whose moral vulgarity has reached the extreme phase.
					
					 It denies a word of sexual slavery and does not admit the crimes related to it. Lurking behind this is the ulterior and foolish attempt of Japan to keep its blood-strained history buried into oblivion by evading an official apology and reparation for its heinous crimes against humanity.
					
					 The denial of crime-woven history is nothing but an open support for it and revelation of its attempt to repeat those crimes. Such sinister intention can never be overlooked.
					
					 If the thrice-cursed crimes committed by the Japanese army in violating women's rights are tolerated, there will be no need to discuss the genuine morality and human rights of the world.
					
					 This is the reason that many countries in the world and even those countries and regions having some relations with Japan are urging the Japanese government to make sincere apology and reparation for Japan's sexual slavery in the past.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that if the issue of Japan's avoidance of apology and reparation is tabled at the UN and an international treaty punishing crimes against women during wartime is concluded, Japan's political situation will become all the more awkward in the international arena. This is becoming a reality.
					
					 Japan should behave itself, clearly facing up to the trend of the times.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Nepal
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Nepali Sakirmata Publishing House published in booklet leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" on July 30.
					 The work, made public on August 4, 1997, deals with the undying feats President Kim Il Sung performed for national reunification and formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as three charters for national reunification.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks and ways for accomplishing the cause for national reunification on the basis of the charters.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Praised by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Praised by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A lecture was given by the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung and film shows were held at the Malaysian Advance Import and Export Company and the Malaysian UM Project Company on August 1 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					 The work made public by Kim Jong Il was a significant, famous one indeed, the chairman of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung said. He went on:
					
					 In his work Kim Jong Il said about the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed for national reunification with his energetic devotion.
					
					 He formulated the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 Today the Korean people are working hard for national reunification, upholding the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, who is carrying forward the high intention of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, at the top posts of the party and state.
					
					 The director of the Malaysian Advance Import and Export Company lauded Kim Jong Il as the greatest man, saying that he indicated the ways for ensuring the peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and bringing earlier national reunification.
					
					 He noted:
					
					 Supporting the north-south joint declarations and implementing them serve as a fundamental guarantee for achieving Korea's reunification as early as possible.
					
					 As there are the leadership of Kim Jong Un and the historic north-south joint declarations, Korea's reunification will be surely realized.
					
					 The director of the Malaysian UM Project Company said that the work made public by Kim Jong Il is an undying programme which indicates the basic principle and ways for reunifying Korea by the Korean nation itself.
					
					 He hoped that Korea will be reunified by the Korean nation itself without any foreign interference under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Pujon Revolutionary Battle Site of DPRK Introduced by ITAR-TASS
articles.content:
Pujon Revolutionary Battle Site of DPRK Introduced by ITAR-TASS
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- ITAR－TASS on July 30 introduced the Pujon Revolutionary Battle Site associated with the revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 The servicepersons of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army built secret bases in the northern mountainous area of Korea in the 1930s and the secret camp on Mt. Okryon in the Pujon Revolutionary Battle Site is one of them, it said, and went on:
					
					 Pujon area is an important place where Kim Jong Suk, a model of devotedly defending the leader, waged revolutionary activities.
					
					 The Korean people laud Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk as three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk mercilessly wiped out enemies with a crack shot marksmanship.
					
					 She was a genuine woman revolutionary and competent political operative who deeply loved the motherland, people and comrades-in-arms. 
					
					 ITAR－TASS said that Kim Jong Il visited this area and gave valuable instructions as for the issues for the management of the revolutionary battle site and education through it.
					
					 It also said that the revolutionary relics are preserved carefully to their former glory.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Praised by Bangladeshi Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Praised by Bangladeshi Party Leader
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, issued a statement on July 31 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					 He said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung advanced the most fair and aboveboard and reasonable national reunification proposal with deep insight into the situation of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The national reunification initiative made by him serves as an immortal great programme which indicates the principle and ways for reunifying the country by the Korean nation itself.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo advanced by Kim Il Sung as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 We are firmly convinced that the party, army and people of the DPRK will surely accomplish the cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is carrying forward the lofty idea of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for national reunification.

articles.title: Japanese Slash at US, S. Korea's Attempted Terrorism against DPRK
articles.content:
Japanese Slash at US, S. Korea's Attempted Terrorism against DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Japanese personages made public statements denouncing the U.S. and south Korean puppet regime for their attempted hideous state-sponsored and politically-motivated terrorism against the DPRK.
					 The acting chairman of the Hokkaido Citizens' Council for Japan-Korea Solidarity referred to the fact that a criminal intruded into the DPRK to blow up statues, which represent the dignity of the supreme leadership the DPRK, and its grand monuments only to be detected and arrested. The criminal was interviewed by journalists on July 19 where he admitted his treason, the acting chairman added.
					
					 There have been various cases due to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK but the gravity of the recent attempted terrorism lies in that it was pushed forward at the U.S. will and by its funding, the acting chairman said, adding:
					
					 The criminal and government authorities who were involved in the above-said terrorism should be well aware of its criminal nature.
					
					 An honorary professor of Saitama University noted that the U.S. is the backstage manipulator of the hideous terrorism against the DPRK, stressing the struggle for independence against imperialism is the way for peace.
					
					 Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, branded the moves to destroy the DPRK's statues and monuments as last-ditch efforts of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean reactionary ruling quarters in collusion with them.
					
					 The attempted terrorism is touching off anger of people of all countries, he said, adding:
					
					 Those involved in the mean plot should face most stern judgement of history.
					
					 There is no doubt that the U.S. imperialists are fast falling into the abyss of ruin.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un inspecciona subunidad adscrita a la Unidad 552 del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un inspecciona subunidad adscrita a la Unidad 552 del EPC
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, inspecciono una subunidad adscrita a la Unidad 552 del EPC.
					El Comandante Supremo respondio cordialmente a las aclamaciones de los militares de la subunidad.
					
					Expresando la esperanza y conviccion de que ellos defenderan con firmeza la mas preciosa patria socialista, les dejo como recuerdo binoculos y fusil automatico y se retrato con ellos.
					
					Tras averiguar como cumple su mision la subunidad, recorrio la sala de mando del servicio de guardia, la de investigacion especializada, etc.
					
					Recibio el parte de que los comandantes y militares se forman como combatientes capaces de cumplir diestramente cualesquier misiones dificiles que les asignen.
					
					Indico que los comandantes deben desarrollar la capacidad de analizar rapido las circunstancias de combate y favorecerlas a las tropas nuestras.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de encontrar sin falta los problemas pendientes en los preparativos de combate y tomar medidas para darles solucion y de enmendar y complementar bien los documentos de combate para que todos los uniformados esten versados en sus misiones de combate.
					
					En la guerra contemporanea, es posible que surjan imprevisibles contingencias, apunto anadiendo que es preciso conocer bien al enemigo para vencerlo con autoctonos metodos de combate.
					
					Acto seguido, Kim Jong Un averiguo el estado de mantenimiento de los equipos tecnicos para el combate.
					
					Averiguo atentamente si esos equipos se mantienen bien siempre, de modo que puedan usarse con eficiencia en cualesquier circunstancias dificiles.
					
					Seguidamente, estuvo en el comedor y el almacen de alimentos subsidiarios de la subunidad.
					
					Recordo que habia leido un documento sobre las unidades ejemplares en el cultivo de soya del ano pasado y la subunidad estuvo incluida en esa lista.
					
					Encomendo que lograra igual exito en este ano evaluando el hecho de que la subunidad alimentara diariamente a los militares mas de 200 gramos de soya.
					
					El mismo dia, Kim Jong Un visito una compania femenina adscrita a la subunidad.
					
					Pasando revista a la sala de educacion, el dormitorio, el bano y otros puntos de la compania, el Comandante Supremo presto profunda atencion a la vida de las soldados.
					
					Dijo que el servicio militar da lo mismo que pasar una carrera de universidad revolucionaria y agrego que se debe prestar atencion primordial a la educacion politica e ideologica.
					
					Ademas de la educacion revolucionaria y la clasista, hay que impartir la educacion de moral a los militares para que ellos puedan desempenar papel importante en la sociedad despues de terminado su servicio militar, enseno.
					
					En el lugar de descanso, presencio la funcion artistica de las militares de la compania.
					
					Las militares de aqui se mantienen en buen estado ideo-espiritual y en la cabeza de ellas no cabra ni la menor idea nociva, por eso decimos que es mejor la cultura del Songun, dijo mostrandose muy complacido.
					
					Paseando en el recinto del cuartel de la compania parecido al parque, asevero que la subunidad ha sido acondicionada excelentemente a las alturas de la era del Songun.
					
					Al final, manifesto la esperanza de que los oficiales y soldados establezcan juntos la ferrea disciplina militar y ostenten el impetu combativo y aspecto de ejercito revolucionario de flor y nata.
					
					En esta ocasion le acompanaron el vicemariscal del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el vicemariscal del EPC Hyon Chol Hae, primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el coronel general del EPC, Jon Chang Bok, y los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Hwang Pyong So y Kim Pyong Ho.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige entrenamiento de vuelo de la Unidad 1017
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige entrenamiento de vuelo de la Unidad 1017
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio el ejercicio de vuelo de la unidad 1017 de las fuerzas aereas y antiaereas del EPC que recibio el titulo de Septimo Regimiento de O Jung Hup
					 Le acogieron en el terreno el comandante de las fuerzas aereas y antiaereas del EPC, Ri Pyong Chol,  y los oficiales de mando de la unidad.
					
					 El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un recibio el parte de recepcion y subio al puesto de mando.
					
					  Luego de informarse del plan correspondiente, dirigio el entrenamiento de vuelo.
					
					  Desde el balcon del puesto de mando, presencio largo tiempo el ejercicio de los pilotos.
					
					  Califico de excelente el entrenamiento y dijo que el sagrado cielo de la patria socialista se mantendra siempre limpio y azul gracias a los aviadores fidedignos que lo defienden firmemente sirviendo de escudos humanos.
					
					  Dio la indicacion de formar a ellos como peloton suicida del cielo y aviadores competentes que puedan enfrentarse diestramente a la guerra contemporanea.
					
					  El se reunio con los pilotos participantes en el entrenamiento y les estimulo.
					
					  Salio a la pista de aterrizaje y paso revista a los aviones.
					
					  Instruyo que los aviadores y los militares encargados de mantenimiento deben cuidar bien los aviones, valiosos equipos de combate para la defensa de patria socialista, de modo que puedan volar en cuanto reciban la orden de despegue.
					
					  Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los militares de la unidad defenderan firmemente el cielo de la patria socialista produciendo un gran salto en las labores para completar los preparativos de combate.
					
					  En esta ocasion le acompanaron el vicemariscal del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el vicemariscal del EPC, Hyon Chol Hae, primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, y los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Hwang Pyong So y Kim Pyong Ho.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam realiza visita de cortesia a Nguyen Phu Trong
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam realiza visita de cortesia a Nguyen Phu Trong
Hanoi, 7 de agosto (corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, realizo el dia 6 una visita de cortesia a Nguyen Phu Trong, secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Vietnam.
					  Kim transmitio al lider del partido vietnamita el saludo que le envia el Maximo Dirigente            Kim Jong Un.
					
					  El secretario general expreso profundo agradecimiento por el respecto y pidio al visitante que trasladara su saludo al Maximo Dirigente.
					
					  El dijo que es un placer que se realizaron con exito los festejos por el centenario del nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung, la IV Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el quinto periodo de sesiones de la XII Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema.
					
					  Subrayo que bajo la sabia direccion del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un el pueblo coreano logra brillantes exitos en la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista.
					
					  Expreso profundo agradecimiento de que el gobierno y el pueblo de Corea apoyaron y ayudaron activamente la lucha del pueblo vietnamita por la liberacion nacional y la reunificacion del pais.
					
					  Destaco que esta seguro de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises preparadas por el Presidente Ho Chi Minh y el Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el ministro de Industria Extractiva Kang Min Chol, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el embajador coreano en Vietnam Kim Chang Il y por la parte vietnamita, el director de la Oficina General de la Presidencia, el asistente al secretario general del Partido Comunista de Vietnam Vu Dung, el jefe de la Comision para Asuntos Exteriores del Comite Central del Partido Comunista Hoang Binh Quan, el vicecanciller Ho Xuan Son y el embajador vietnamita en Corea Le Quang Ba.   
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam conversa con Truong Tan Sang
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam conversa  con Truong Tan Sang
Hanoi, 7 de agosto (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 6 en la presidencia con el presidente de la Republica Socialista de Vietnam, Truong Tan Sang.
					 En la ocasion, ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el tema de intensificar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y otros de interes mutuo. 
					
					La parte coreana se refirio a  la autoctona direccion del Maximo Dirigente   Kim Jong Un quien dirige sabiamente al partido, el ejercito y el pueblo a la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista. 
					
					Destaco la necesidad de desarrollar mas las relaciones bilaterales de ambos paises e intensificar de continuo las colaboraciones en las escenas regionales e internacionales incluyendo el MNOAL.
					
					La parte vietnamita felicito el enaltecimiento del Maximo Dirigente en el puesto supremo del partido y el Estado y deseo que el pueblo coreano logre notables resultados en la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista bajo la orientacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					Asevero que el partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de Vietnam se esforzaran por intensificar y desarrollar las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion de ambos paises preparadas por el presidente Ho Chi Minh y el Presidente Kim Il Sung. 
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.
					
					Participaron en la ocasion el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el ministro de Industria Extractiva Kang Min Chol, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el embajador coreano en Vietnam Kim Chang Il, por la parte coreana y por la vietnamita, el director de la Oficina General de la Presidencia, el ministro de Industria y Comercio, Vu Huy Hoang, el vicecanciller Ho Xuan Son, el embajador vietnamita en Corea Le Quang Ba, el asistente al presidente, Nguyen Duc Di, y otros personajes relacionados.

articles.title: Tendran lugar conversaciones de cruz roja RPDC-Japon
articles.content:
Tendran lugar conversaciones de cruz roja RPDC-Japon
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tendran lugar los dias 9 y 10 en Beijing de China las conversaciones entre la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja de Japon.

articles.title: ACNC comenta la bajeza moral de Japon
articles.content:
ACNC comenta la bajeza moral de Japon
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el 24 del julio pasado en el Capitolio de Estados Unidos un acto dedicado al 5o aniversario de la aprobacion de la resolucion referente al problema de esclavas sexuales del ejercito japones.
					En la ocasion, fue expresada la preocupacion de que las autoridades japonesas rehusaran obstinadamente esa resolucion que demanda la excusa y la indemnizacion por el crimen de haber convertido a las coreanas y otras mujeres de Asia en esclavas sexuales.
					
					Durante el acto, se dio enfasis en llevar a la ONU ese problema y desarrollar la resolucion como tratado internacional para castigar las barbaries cometidas contra las mujeres en guerra.
					
					Este hecho muestra que crece dia tras dia la indignacion de la sociedad internacional por Japon que no reconoce siquiera el crimen de esclavitud sexual cometido durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
					
					En el siglo pasado, el imperialismo japones secuestro y llevo forzadamente a 200 mil coreanas solo en Corea y las convirtio en esclavas sexuales de sus tropas agresoras.
					
					Ademas, para ocultar su abominable fechoria, mato en masas a ellas.
					
					La esclavitud sexual es crimen de lesa humanidad sin precedentes en la historia de la humanidad.
					
					El mismo premier japones califica inmoralmente de erronea la expresion de esclava sexual del ejercito nipon.
					
					Este disparate de la maxima autoridad de Japon permite suponer la posicion y actitud de los politicos japoneses sobre el problema de indemnizacion de los crimenes de guerra.
					
					En el mismo contexto, los reaccionarios de ese pais chismean abiertamente que la esclavitud sexual fue "acto de algunos alcahuetes individuales" y las victimas "se ofrecieron voluntarias por el dinero".
					
					De hecho, Japon es el pais corrupto de bajeza moral. 
					
					Para dejar en el olvido de la historia ese tremendo crimen de lesa humanidad y su historia de agresiones manchadas de sangre, Japon no los reconoce negando la expresion de esclava sexual y elude la excusa oficial y la indemnizacion.
					
					No se puede tolerar nunca tal postura que parte de la siniestra intencion de repetir ese antecedente criminal.
					
					No existiran las razones de discutir la verdadera moral y los derechos humanos si se perdona ese caso de violacion de DDHH de la poblacion femenina cometida por el ejercito japones.
					
					Por eso, numerosos paises del mundo y hasta los paises y regiones que mantienen relaciones con el pais isleno urgen al gobierno japones la excusa e indemnizacion consecuente del crimen.
					
					Esta claro que se tornara mas desfavorable en la escena internacional la situacion politica de Japon si su actitud en cuanto al tema se somete a la discusion de la ONU y se aprueba por el respecto un tratado internacional que castigue los ultrajes a la poblacion femenina durante la guerra. 
					
					Eso se hace realidad.
					
					Japon debera actuar con prudencia viendo correctamente la corriente de la epoca.
